definition: to check up on sb's achievements
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father

sentences.english: With the results of staff appraisal, I understand my professional development needs.
sentences.chinese: 藉著考績結果，我瞭解自己的專業發展需要。

sentences.english: The staff appraisal system including assessment criteria and procedures is clear.
sentences.chinese: 教職員考績制度，包括評估準則和程序均清楚。

sentences.english: Personal expertise can not be qualified for positions they bear. 3. Frail incompetent or performance as the C class Di.
sentences.chinese: 身體衰弱，不能勝任工作的，或考績列爲丙等的。

sentences.english: Many companies make an annual evaluation of their employees.
sentences.chinese: 很多公司每年都會針對員工的表現來打考績。

sentences.english: We're doing our annual evaluation of all employees.
sentences.chinese: 我們現在正在替每位員工打考績。

sentences.english: I fully understand the appraisal system including assessment criteria and procedures.
sentences.chinese: 我清楚瞭解教職員考績制度，包括評估準則和程序。

definition: scholar preparing for imperial examinations (in former times)
to be in overall charge/to oversee
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
to propose (for a job)/to nominate/to recommend
funds and provisions for the troops/(soldier's) pay
to die or be martyred for a noble cause/to be faithful unto death
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
to give a detailed exposition/to state in detail
lit. to fall behind Sun Shan 孫山|孙山[Sun1 Shan1] (who came last in the imperial examination) (idiom)/fig. to fail an exam/to fall behind (in a competition)
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
